title: Distinguished Talent visa
summary: This page provides detailed information about the Distinguished Talent visa (subclass 124), a permanent visa for individuals with exceptional and outstanding achievements in eligible fields. The visa is closed to new applications, directing applicants to the Global Talent visa (subclass 858). The page outlines visa benefits, eligibility requirements, costs, obligations, and related conditions.

structured_data.description: A permanent visa for people with an internationally recognised record of exceptional and outstanding achievement in an eligible field.

notes: Additional charges apply for each family member.
Applicants 18 or older without functional English must pay the second instalment.
Other costs may apply for health checks, police certificates, and biometrics.
Factors include completeness of application, response times, required checks, external agency processing, and migration program capacity.

benefits_with_visa: Sponsor eligible relatives for permanent residence
Apply for Australian citizenship if eligible
Travel to and from Australia for 5 years

application_conditions.apply_from: You can be in or outside Australia when applying, but not in immigration clearance.
application_conditions.grant_condition: You must be outside Australia when the visa is granted.
notes: If already in Australia on an eligible visa, applicants should consider eligibility for subclass 858.

include_family.description: You can include members of the family unit when applying or anytime before a decision is made.
extra_rules_for_under_18: Can include members of the family unit of that parent
requirements: Family members must meet health and character requirements.

travel_rights.tool: VEVO to check travel facility expiry

structured_data.visa_label: Visa is digitally linked to passport; no physical label provided.

main_criteria: Must be outside Australia when visa is granted
Must have internationally recognised record of exceptional and outstanding achievement
Must be nominated by eligible individual or organisation

benefit_to_community.description: Applicant must contribute to Australia as a whole.

ability_to_establish_in_australia.description: Must be able to find work in field or be independently established in field.
ability_to_establish_in_australia.restriction: Cannot include income from work outside field.

must_have: Superior abilities to others in the field
Record of sustained achievement unlikely to diminish
Participation in a field recognised and accepted in Australia with international standing
Prominence in the field within the past 2 years

requirements: Nominator must be Australian citizen, permanent resident, eligible New Zealand citizen, or Australian organisation
Nominator must have national reputation in the applicantâ€™s field
Nomination should come from peak Australian body where appropriate

special_conditions: Applicants under 18 must be of exceptional benefit to Australia
Applicants 55 or older must be of exceptional benefit to Australia

applies_to: Family members aged 16 or over applying

debt_to_government.requirement: All debts owed by applicant or family members must be repaid or arrangements made.

obligations: Contribute to Australia in field of expertise
